column4: Can I mount a bin file the same way that I would mount an iso file?
no, convert it to a useful format with bchunk
depends what you want it to do
simple IRC client with no gui

not a service in the windows sense... but a service such as it doesn't take input from a user on the windows machine... it takes input through the IRC connection...
then that will be fairly simple
except windows has it's own crackpot sockets stuff
I'd try using CommonC++ to abstract it away
